questions.question: Which of the following public health centers do First Referral Units (FRUs) and non-FRUSbelong to?
A district has a population of 20 lakhs. According to the IPHS 2022 guidelines, approximatelyhow many beds should the district public health system have for this population?
questions.explanation: In a district having a population of 20 lakhs, the number of beds the district public health systemshould have is given as follows: 2000 essential and 4000 desirable.According to IPHS 2022 norms for the number of beds in district hospitals, 1 bed per 1000population is essential and 2 beds per thousand population would be desirable.Therefore, in a population of 20,00,000 the district public health system should have 2000essential and 4000 desirable beds.The essential number of beds should be achieved through the public health system of tertiary care(medical colleges), secondary care (DH, SDH, CHCs), and primary care in the district (PHCs andCHCs).

questions.question: Which of the following is not true about district and sub-district hospitals?756

options.A: All districts need at least two district hospitals.
options.B: The minimum essential number of beds in a sub-district hospital is 100.
options.C: All districts do not need a sub-district hospital.
options.D: DNB training can be done in district hospitals.

questions.explanation: Every district should have at least one comprehensively functioning district hospital (DH).District hospitals and subdistrict hospitals provide secondary care health services. Every districtshould have at least one comprehensively functioning DH. Districts with a population of less than5 lakhs and with a functional DH do not need a subdistrict hospital (SDH). Districts with apopulation of 5–10 lakhs can have one SDH. For a population of more than 10 lakhs, 1 SDH isneeded for every 10 lakh population.The three pillars of district hospital services are providing clinical care, providing a knowledgehub for capacity development, and public health programs.Important functions of DHs:• Providing curative services•• Palliative and rehabilitative services• Implementation of health programs•• Drugs and diagnostic services• Administrative and other support services• Health promotion and prevention, education• Providing educational services, like Diplomate of National Board (DNB) training; trainingcourses for healthcare professionals (HCPs) in auxiliary nursing and midwifery (ANM),telemedicine, and technology; and partnerships with universities

questions.question: Which of the following is the correct statement regarding Community Health Centers(CHCs)?

options.A: Non-FRU CHCs should have 50 essential beds.
options.B: Non-FRU CHCs can be located in urban areas.
options.C: FRU-CHCs can be located in rural areas.
options.D: Elective surgeries will not be performed at FRU-CHCs.

questions.explanation: First Referral Unit - Community Health centers (FRU-CHCs) can be located in rural areas.Community health centers (CHC) can be classified into the following types:•⚫ Non-FRU-CHCs - They are located in rural areas. They provide preventive, promotive, palliative,and rehabilitative services. They also have curative services for normal delivery, stabilization of761common emergencies, etc.• FRU-CHCs are the first centers of referral from smaller centers such as sub-centers or primaryhealth centers. They can be located in rural as well as urban areas. Apart from providing theabovementioned essential services, they also provide specialized services and elective surgeries.All the CHCs located in urban areas are FRU-CHCs.In addition to the above centers, CHCs called Block Health Public Units (BHPU) may be located inthe block headquarters. Apart from clinical and public health services, they have a healthmanagement information system (HMIS). They also help in decentralizing health services.

questions.question: A rural hilly area has a population of 40,000. How many Primary Health Centers (PHCs)should it have?
questions.explanation: A rural hilly area with a population of 40,000 should have 2 Primary Health Centers (PHCs).According to the latest IPHS 2022 guidelines, in hilly areas, there should be one PHC for every20,000 population. Since this village has a population of 40,000, it should have 2 PHCs.

questions.question: All of the following surgical procedures can be conducted in a Primary Health Center (PHC)except
questions.explanation: Cholecystectomy is not a surgical procedure that is conducted in a PHC. The surgical proceduresdone in PHC include suturing of wounds, incision and drainage of abscesses, vasectomy,tubectomy, and hydrocelectomy.Services provided under PHC:• General services: OPD, teleconsultation services• Emergency services• 24x7 labor rooms763•Antenatal clinics, non-communicable diseases (NCD) clinics• Rotational specialist clinics●Surgical procedures:•Suturing of wounds••Incision and drainage of abscesses• Vasectomy, tubectomy, hydrocelectomy in PHCs with a functional minor OT, and standardinfection-prevention protocols• Antenatal care and services:• Detecting pregnancy• Provision of ANC and counseling services• Identification, management, and referral of high-risk pregnancies• Detection of alarming signs during pregnancy and labor with timely and appropriate referral• Monitoring high-risk pregnancies• Management of malaria for pregnant women, as per National Center for Vector Borne DiseasesControl (NCVBDC) guidelines•Management of tuberculosis during pregnancy• Management of mild/moderate anemia•Management of gestational diabetes mellitus, as per Government of India guidelines

questions.question: You are a medical officer in an Urban Health and Wellness Center (UHWC). The populationof the place is 10,000. How many ASHA workers are needed for your UHWC?
questions.explanation: In a place with a population of 10,000, 5 ASHA workers are needed.There are two forms of Health and Wellness Centers in Sub-Health Centers.•⚫ Health and Wellness Centre - Sub-Health Center (HWC-SHC) in rural areas: It requires 1 ASHAper 1000 population or 1 ASHA per habitation in hilly/tribal areas. It has a total staff of 3 +ASHAS.• Urban Health and Wellness Center (UHWC): It requires 1 ASHA per 2000 population and 1ANM per 10000 population. Health and wellness center- Sub-Center 1 ASHA per 1,000population or 1 ASHA per habitation in hilly/tribal areas. It has a total staff of 4 + ASHAS.Functions of HWCs under Sub-Health Centers:• Provide primary care services• Deliver the 12 packages under CPHC• Serve as a platform for teleconsultation and widening the range of diagnostics• Serve as a fulcrum for services in National Health Programmes764

questions.question: You are posted as a medical officer in a rural Health and Wellness Center - Primary HealthCenter (HWC-PHC). According to the IPHS 2022 guidelines, which of the following isincorrect regarding the essential manpower required for this PHC?
questions.explanation: Specialists like ophthalmologists are not included as essential manpower for a PHC. Specialists formedicine, obstetrics & gynecology, pediatrics, ophthalmology, etc. are essential manpowerincluded under polyclinics.According to the Indian Public Health Standards (IPHS) 2022 guidelines, a total of 12 staff isconsidered essential manpower for a PHC. They include 1 Medical Officer (MBBS), 2 staffnurses, 1 pharmacist, 1 health worker female/ANM, 1 health worker/health assistant (male),1 health assistant (female)/lady health visitor, 1 laboratory technician, 1 data entry operator, 1dresser, 1 accountant, and 1 sanitation staff.765
